metadata.title: CVE-2022-4095 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in Linux kernel before 5.19.2. This issueoccurs in cmd_hdl_filter in drivers/staging/rtl8712/rtl8712_cmd.c, allowingan attacker to launch a local denial of service attack and gain escalationof privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-201-generic - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-201-generic - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-201-lowlatency - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-kvm - 4.4.0-1119.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1156-aws - 4.4.0-1156.171
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-aws - 4.15.0-1147.159~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-azure - 4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-gcp - 4.15.0-1142.158~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-oracle - 4.15.0-1112.123~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.129').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1156.171').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.159~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.158~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.123~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
